title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A 
– Temporary Restrictions) (Covid – 19) (Relevant Counties) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 8th day of August
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited health act 1947 (section 31a - temporary restrictions) (covid - 19) (relevant counties) regulation 2020 (2) regulation shall come operation 8th day august

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 2. (1) These Regulations shall remain in operation until the 23rd day of
text_raw:
2. (1) These Regulations shall remain in operation until the 23rd day of 

August 2020. 

(2) These Regulations shall have effect notwithstanding any other 
Regulation made under section 31A of the Act of 1947 that conflicts with these 
Regulations. 

Interpretation

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: In these Regulations -
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations - 

“Act of 1947” means the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947); 

“Act of 2001” means the Local Government Act 2001 (No. 37 of 2001); 

“applicable person” means a person whose place of residence is located within 
a relevant county; 

“county” has the same meaning as it has in section 10 (amended by section 12 
of the Local Government Reform Act 2014 (No. 1 of 2014)) of the Act of 
2001, being a Local Government Area that is listed as a County in Schedule 5 
to the Act of 2001; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 11th August, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [295] 3 

 “county of residence”, in relation to an applicable person, means the county in 
which his or her place of residence is situated; 

“place of residence”, in relation to an applicable person, means – 

(a) 

(b) 

the premises that comprise the person’s home, or 

if the person does not have a home or is not residing in his or her 
home, such other premises, if any, at which he or she is 
currently residing, whether on a permanent or temporary basis; 

“relevant county” means a county that is – 

(a) 

listed in Schedule 1, and 

(b) 

located in a relevant geographical location; 

“relevant geographical location” means a geographical location to which an 
affected areas order applies; 

“vulnerable person” means - 

(a) 

(b) 

a person who normally requires assistance in carrying out his or 
her daily activities, 

a person who, although not normally requiring assistance in 
carrying out his or her daily activities, requires such assistance 
because he or she is - 

(i) 

particularly susceptible to the risk posed to health by 
Covid-19, or 

(ii) not in a position to leave his or her place of residence due 
to reasons related to the spread of Covid-19 or otherwise, 

or 

(c) 

a child. 

Restriction of movement relating to relevant counties

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 4. (1) An applicable person shall not travel from his or her county of
text_raw:
4. (1) An applicable person shall not travel from his or her county of 

residence to another county without reasonable excuse. 

(2) Subject to paragraph (3), a person other than an applicable person shall 
not travel to a relevant county from any other county, including another 
relevant county, without reasonable excuse. 

(3) Paragraph (2) shall not apply to a person who travels to a relevant 
county in a vehicle, where the person subsequently leaves the relevant county 
without having exited the vehicle for any reason other than to refuel the vehicle 
or for reasons of an emergency. 

(4) Without prejudice to the generality of what constitutes a reasonable 
excuse for the purposes of paragraphs (1) and (2), a reasonable excuse for 
travelling from the county of residence in the case of an applicable person, or 
travelling to a relevant county in the case of a person other than an applicable 
person, includes travelling in order to - 

 
 
 
 4 [295] 

(a) work, comply with a contract of employment or contract for 

services, or otherwise engage in work or employment, 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

farm, carry out agricultural activities, or assist in farming or 
carrying out agricultural activities, 

attend a medical or dental appointment, or accompany, to such 
an appointment, any other person residing in the relevant 
residence or a vulnerable person, 

seek essential medical, health or dental assistance for the person, 
for any other person residing with the person, or for a vulnerable 
person, 

donate blood or accompany any other person residing in the 
relevant residence to donate blood, 

seek veterinary assistance, 

attend to vital family matters (including providing care to 
vulnerable persons), 

(h) 

attend a funeral, 

(i) 

(j) 

fulfil a legal obligation (including attending court, satisfying bail 
conditions, or participating in ongoing legal proceedings), attend 
legal 
a court office where required, 
proceedings or execute essential legal documents, 

initiate emergency 

if the person is a parent or guardian of a child, or a person 
having a right of access to a child, give effect to arrangements 
for access to the child by - 

(i) 

the person, or 

(ii) 

another person who is - 

(I) 

a parent or guardian of the child, or 

(II) a person having a right of access to the child, 

(k) 

in the case of a minister of religion or priest (or any equivalent 
thereof in any religion) - 

(i) 

lead worship or services remotely through the use of 
information and communications technology, 

(ii) minister to the sick, or 

(iii) conduct funeral services, 

(l) move to another residence where, in all the circumstances of the 

case, such movement is reasonably necessary, or 

(m) provide emergency assistance, avoid injury or illness, or escape 
a risk of harm, whether to the person or to another person. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [295] 5 

Restrictions on events and funerals

4 295 (a) work comply contract employment contract service otherwise engage work employment (b) (c) (d) (e) (f) (g) farm carry agricultural activity assist farming carrying agricultural activity attend medical dental appointment accompany appointment person residing relevant residence vulnerable person seek essential medical health dental assistance person person residing person vulnerable person donate blood accompany person residing relevant residence donate blood seek veterinary assistance attend vital family matter (including providing care vulnerable persons) (h) attend funeral (i) (j) fulfil legal obligation (including attending court satisfying bail condition participating ongoing legal proceedings) attend legal court office required proceeding execute essential legal document initiate emergency person parent guardian child person right access child give effect arrangement access child - (i) person (ii) another person - (i) parent guardian child (ii) person right access child (k) case minister religion priest (or equivalent thereof religion) - (i) lead worship service remotely use information communication technology (ii) minister sick (iii) conduct funeral service (l) move another residence circumstance case movement reasonably necessary (m) provide emergency assistance avoid injury illness escape risk harm whether person another person 295 5 restriction event funeral

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 5. (1) A person shall not organise, or cause to be organised, an event for
text_raw:
5. (1) A person shall not organise, or cause to be organised, an event for 
cultural, entertainment, sporting or community reasons to be held in a relevant 
county other than where one or more of the following applies - 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

in the case of an event to be held indoors, the maximum number 
of persons attending, or proposed to attend, the event (for 
whatever reason) does not exceed 6 persons, 

in the case of an event to be held outdoors, the maximum 
number of persons attending, or proposed to attend, the event 
(for whatever reason) does not exceed 15 persons, 

the person so organising the event, or so causing the event to be 
organised, takes all reasonable steps to ensure that the number of 
persons attending, or proposed to attend, the event (for whatever 
reason) does not exceed, in the case of an indoor event, 6 
persons, and in the case of an outdoor event, 15 persons. 

(2) A person shall not organise, or cause to be organised, a funeral to be 

held in a relevant county other than where- 

(i) 

(ii) 

the number of people, excluding a minister of religion or priest 
(or any equivalent thereof in any religion), attending an element 
of the funeral held outdoors does not exceed 25, and 

the number of people, excluding a minister of religion or priest 
(or any equivalent thereof in any religion), attending an element 
of the funeral held indoors does not exceed 6. 

(3) Paragraph (1) is a penal provision for the purposes of section 31A of 

the Act of 1947. 

Restriction of movement of applicable persons in relation to exercise and 
social or recreational purposes
text_norm: 5 (1) person shall organise cause organised event cultural entertainment sporting community reason held relevant county one following applies - (i) (ii) (iii) case event held indoors maximum number person attending proposed attend event (for whatever reason) exceed 6 person case event held outdoors maximum number person attending proposed attend event (for whatever reason) exceed 15 person person organising event causing event organised take reasonable step ensure number person attending proposed attend event (for whatever reason) exceed case indoor event 6 person case outdoor event 15 person (2) person shall organise cause organised funeral held relevant county where- (i) (ii) number people excluding minister religion priest (or equivalent thereof religion) attending element funeral held outdoors exceed 25 number people excluding minister religion priest (or equivalent thereof religion) attending element funeral held indoors exceed 6 (3) paragraph (1) penal provision purpose section 31a act 1947 restriction movement applicable person relation exercise social recreational purpose

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 6. (1) Subject to paragraphs (2) to (4), an applicable person shall not
text_raw:
6. (1) Subject to paragraphs (2) to (4), an applicable person shall not 
engage or otherwise participate in a relevant activity outside his or her place of 
residence (in this Regulation referred to as the “relevant residence”). 

(2) An applicable person may, within the county in which the relevant 

residence is situated – 

(a) 

exercise outdoors alone, 

(b) 

exercise outdoors – 

(i) with other persons residing in the relevant residence, 

(ii) with a maximum of 14 other persons who do not reside in 

the relevant residence, or 

(iii) with a maximum of 14 other persons, where one or more 
of such other persons resides in the relevant residence and 
one or more of such other persons does not so reside, 

(c) 

go out alone for recreational purposes, 

 
 
 
 6 [295] 

(d) gather indoors for social or recreational purposes together with – 

(i) 

other persons residing in the relevant residence, 

(ii) 

a maximum of 5 other persons who do not reside in the 
relevant residence, provided that those persons, together, 
represent no more than three places of residence or 

(iii) a maximum of 5 other persons, where one or more of such 
other persons resides in the relevant residence and one or 
more of such other persons does not so reside, provided 
that those persons, together, represent no more than three 
places of residence, or 

(e) gather outdoors for social or recreational purposes together with – 

(i) 

other persons residing in the relevant residence, 

(ii) 

a maximum of 14 other persons who do not reside in the 
relevant residence, or 

(iii) a maximum of 14 other persons, where one or more of 
such other persons resides in the relevant residence and 
one or more of such other persons does not so reside. 

(3) An applicable person may engage or otherwise participate in training 

relating to a sport, where – 

(a) 

the person, in respect of the sport concerned – 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

(iv) 

is in receipt of financial support provided by Sport Ireland 
under the scheme commonly known and referred to as the 
Sport Ireland International Carding Scheme, 

competes at a senior level and is a participant in a high 
performance training programme of the national governing 
body of the sport, which body receives, from Sport 
Ireland, financial support commonly known and referred 
to as the Sport Ireland High Performance Programme 
Funding, 

is a member of an inter-county team, at senior or minor 
level, in a competition organised by the organisation 
commonly known and referred to as the Gaelic Athletic 
Association, or 

is a professional sportsperson who receives payment for 
training and playing the sport under a contract of 
employment with a soccer club or the rugby football 
organisation commonly known and referred to as the Irish 
Rugby Football Union, 

(b) 

(c) 

the training is supervised by a member of staff of Sport Ireland, 
a coach or a trainer, and 

it is in the best interests of the ongoing improvement, 
maintenance or enhancement of the person’s performance in that 
sport to undergo such training. 

 
 
 [295] 7 

(4) In this Regulation – 

“relevant activities” means activities that are engaged in or participated in 
solely for - 

(a) 

social or recreational purposes, or 

(b) 

the purposes of exercise; 

“social or recreational purposes” includes leisure or holiday purposes. 

Carrying on or provision of relevant business or service

(i) person residing relevant residence (ii) maximum 5 person reside relevant residence provided person together represent three place residence (iii) maximum 5 person one person resides relevant residence one person reside provided person together represent three place residence (e) gather outdoors social recreational purpose together - (i) person residing relevant residence (ii) maximum 14 person reside relevant residence (iii) maximum 14 person one person resides relevant residence one person reside (3) applicable person may engage otherwise participate training relating sport - (a) person respect sport concerned - (i) (ii) (iii) (iv) receipt financial support provided sport ireland scheme commonly known referred sport ireland international carding scheme competes senior level participant high performance training programme national governing body sport body receives sport ireland financial support commonly known referred sport ireland high performance programme funding member inter-county team senior minor level competition organised organisation commonly known referred gaelic athletic association professional sportsperson receives payment training playing sport contract employment soccer club rugby football organisation commonly known referred irish rugby football union (b) (c) training supervised member staff sport ireland coach trainer best interest ongoing improvement maintenance enhancement person performance sport undergo training 295 7 (4) regulation - relevant activity mean activity engaged participated solely - (a) social recreational purpose (b) purpose exercise social recreational purpose includes leisure holiday purpose carrying provision relevant business service

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 7. (1) A specified person shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that
text_raw:
7. (1) A specified person shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that 
members of the public are not permitted, or otherwise granted, access to a 
premises in a relevant county, or to a part of such a premises, where a relevant 
business or service is carried on or otherwise provided. 

(2) Paragraph (1) is a penal provision for the purposes of section 31A of 

the Act of 1947. 

(3) For the avoidance of doubt, paragraph (1) does not prohibit - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the filming or other recording of performances in a theatre, 
concert hall, museum or art gallery, without an audience present, 
for the purposes of broadcasting such performances on the 
internet, radio or television, 

the holding of horseracing or greyhound racing at a racecourse, 
where no persons are in attendance at the racecourse solely for 
the purposes of spectating such racing, or 

the use of a premises, or part of a premises, for the purposes of a 
meeting of a local authority (within the meaning of the Act of 
2001). 

(4) In this Regulation – 

“relevant business or service” means a business or service of a type specified in 
Schedule 2; 

“specified person”, in relation to a relevant business or service, means – 

(a) 

the occupier, 

(b) 

the manager, or 

(c) 

any other person for the time being in charge, 

of the premises, or part of the premises, where the relevant business or service 
is carried on or otherwise provided. 

 
 
 
 
 
 8 [295] 

Regulation 3
text_norm: 7 (1) specified person shall take reasonable step ensure member public permitted otherwise granted access premise relevant county part premise relevant business service carried otherwise provided (2) paragraph (1) penal provision purpose section 31a act 1947 (3) avoidance doubt paragraph (1) prohibit - (a) (b) (c) filming recording performance theatre concert hall museum art gallery without audience present purpose broadcasting performance internet radio television holding horseracing greyhound racing racecourse person attendance racecourse solely purpose spectating racing use premise part premise purpose meeting local authority (within meaning act 2001) (4) regulation - relevant business service mean business service type specified schedule 2 specified person relation relevant business service mean - (a) occupier (b) manager (c) person time charge premise part premise relevant business service carried otherwise provided 8 295 regulation 3

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 18. Hotels or similar accommodation services, other than insofar as they are
text_raw:
18. Hotels or similar accommodation services, other than insofar as they are 
providing – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

essential accommodation (including accommodation for homeless 
persons and persons in direct provision and persons who are unable 
to reside in their usual place of residence due to reasons related to 
the spread of Covid-19 or otherwise), 

accommodation for a person that is necessary for the purposes of 
his or her work or employment, 

accommodation for a person that is necessary to permit or enable 
him or her to attend a funeral, 

accommodation for a person that is necessary to permit or enable 
him or her to fulfil legal obligations, 

accommodation for a person that is necessary to permit or enable 
him or her to receive medical or dental treatment, 

accommodation for a person that is necessary for vital family 
reasons, or 

accommodation which was being provided at the time of the 
coming into operation of these Regulations, for the remainder of 
the period of time for which such accommodation was booked, 
providing that the provision of such accommodation is continuous.

heading: 19. Outlets selling food or beverages (including an outlet in relation to which
text_raw:

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

insofar as they sell food or beverages on a takeaway basis or for 
consumption off the premises, 

insofar as they sell food or beverages for consumption in an area of 
part of the premises the entirety of which is situated outdoors, or 

staff canteens operating for the exclusive use of persons working 
in, or at, a particular premises.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 22. Sports stadiums, campuses and sports training facilities other than insofar
text_raw:
22. Sports stadiums, campuses and sports training facilities other than insofar 
as – 

(a) 

(b) 

they are available free of charge for informal and recreational 
use by members of the public, 

their operation is necessary for athletic use and training by 
persons specified in Regulation 6(3) or by the coaching and 
support personnel of such persons, or 

 
 
 [295] 11 

(c) 

their operation is necessary for the purposes of organising an 
outdoor event for sporting or educational reasons in accordance 
with Regulation 6, or for holding such an event. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

8 August, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for certain temporary restrictions in County Kildare, 
County Laois and County Offaly because of Covid-19. The Regulations remain 
in operation until 23 August 2020.
